gpt.output: Attack inferred: BrainWash. Final evaluation confirms a catastrophic success of the BrainWash attack: BWT plummets to -47.86 pp (Δ -46.12 pp), average accuracy drops to 13.62% with prior-task performance at chance (~10%), and last-task accuracy is 46.0%. These signatures, together with prior execution records of BrainWash (reckless mode), decisively identify BrainWash rather than Accumulative Attack, Label Flipping, or a clean scenario, albeit with unusually high severity.
warnings: Observed severity greatly exceeds paper-reported BrainWash reckless (ε=0.1); this suggests a stronger poisoning rate or misconfiguration but does not change the attack identification.
evidence: RAG verdict: Severe attack-induced collapse confirmed.
BWT before: -1.74 pp; BWT after: -47.86 pp; ΔBWT: -46.12 pp (27.6× increase in magnitude).
Prior tasks 0–8 final accuracies average 10.02% ≈ chance for 10-way splits (near-total forgetting).
Last-task accuracy: 46.0% (vs clean 68.3%, vs BrainWash reckless 51.0%).
Comparison to baselines (CIFAR-100, EWC): BWT is -47.86 pp vs clean -5.2 pp (≈9.2× more negative); -35.3 pp worse than BrainWash reckless (-12.6 pp).
Logs show stable run and normal termination (exit_code=0) with Fisher computation progressing to 100%.
gpt.summary: Attack inferred: BrainWash. Final evaluation confirms a catastrophic success of the BrainWash attack: BWT plummets to -47.86 pp (Δ -46.12 pp), average accuracy drops to 13.62% with prior-task performance at chance (~10%), and last-task accuracy is 46.0%. These signatures, together with prior execution records of BrainWash (reckless mode), decisively identify BrainWash rather than Accumulative Attack, Label Flipping, or a clean scenario, albeit with unusually high severity.
